alert.note: Alert for Central Virginia Blue Ridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 16 at 2:51AM EST until January 17 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Total snow accumulation of 3 to 5 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. * WHERE...Central Virginia Blue Ridge. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM EST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 7 PM this evening to 7 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow intensity should gradually taper off through the remainder of the night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
